consume.translation[0].definitions[0].de: to use time, energy, goods etc
consume.translation[0].definitions[0].ex: Only 27% of the paper we consume is recycled.
A smaller vehicle will consume less fuel.
consume.translation[0].definitions[1].ex: Alcohol may not be consumed on the premises.
consume.translation[0].definitions[2].de: if a feeling or idea consumes you, it affects you very strongly, so that you cannot think about anything else
consume.translation[0].definitions[2].ex: She was scared by the depression which threatened to consume her.
He was consumed with guilt after the accident.
consume.translation[0].definitions[3].de: if fire consumes something, it destroys it completely
consume.translation[1].definitions[0].de: to buy and use goods, services, energy, or natural materials
consume.translation[1].definitions[0].ex: Never underestimate the power of the American citizen to consume.
The UK and France consume more gas than Italy, mainly because of their colder climates.
consume.translation[1].definitions[1].de: to use money or time that could be used for something else
consume.translation[1].definitions[1].ex: Expenses consume less than 16 cents of every revenue dollar at Wal-Mart.
Lawsuits consume time and hurt a companyâ€™s image.
